Name: Sugar palm
糖棕
Common: fruit, root, flower of sugar palm

Geography: Palmyra Island in the South Pacific
Southern China (Guangdong, Hainan, Guangxi, Yunnan, Taiwan, Fujian Xiamen, Zhangzhou, Sanya, Dongfang, Baoting, Qionghai, Danzhou)
Palmyra Island (belonging to US, in the South Pacific)
Medical Function: used as stimulant (in folk medicine in Pakistan)
used as diuretic and antiphlogistic (folk medicine in Pakistan)
fruit: increases appetite, digestive, sedative, laxative, aphrodisiac
roots and juice: anti-inflammatory effect
ash obtained by burning inflorescence: good antacid and antiperiodic, useful in heartburn, splenomegaly and bilious fever
anti-hyperglycemic effect: flabelliferin II possesses the effect of lowering blood glucose with no side effect

Research: Antioxidant and cytotoxicity potential were studied for alcohol and petroleum ether extract of Borassus flabellifer Linn. fresh pulp rich in vitamins A and C
male inflorescence: spirostane-type steroid saponins like borassosides and dioscin

Name: dong kui zi
qing ma zi
Common: qing ma zi: Abutilon seed, Chingma seed
dong kui zi: curly mallow seed

Geography: tropical and subtropical areas of Asia
Maladies Treated: 腎結石濕熱蘊結下焦者
Medical Function: 清熱利濕 (clearing heat and draining dampness)
解毒 (detoxification)
退水 (relieving edema)
用於治二便不通，淋病，水腫，婦女乳汁不行，乳房腫痛，赤白痢疾，淋病澀痛，支氣管炎，膀胱炎，癰腫目翳等。
茼麻子具清利濕熱，退水功能。
婦人孔房脹痛，冬葵子，砂仁等分為末，熱酒服三錢，其腫即消。

Pai shi fang (expelling stone formula): used for kidney stones with urinary tract infection. Composition: hua shi, jin qian cao 30g each, dong kui zi, hai jin sha 15g each, bian xu, ju mai, raw ji nei jin, che qian zi 12g each, wang bu liu xing 10g, niu xi, chuan lian zi 9g each, mu tong, gan cao 6g each. Mu tong can be omitted due to risk of getting toxic variety. 功效: 有清熱利濕, 通淋排石的功效。
Samples of Formulae: Pai shi fang (expelling stone formula): kidney stones with urinary tract infection. Composition: hua shi, jin qian cao 30g each, dong kui zi, hai jin sha 15g each, bian xu, ju mai, raw ji nei jin, che qian zi 12g each, wang bu liu xing 10g, niu xi, chuan lian zi 9g each, mu tong, gan cao 6g each. Mu tong can be omitted due to risk of getting toxic variety. 煎服方法: 用水煎服，每日1劑，有清熱利濕、通淋排石的功效。
Contraindications: Not to be used in cases of qi deficient or pixu (spleen deficient) with loose stool or during pregnancies. 氣虛或脾虛腸滑者，懷孕者忌用。
Notes: The dong kui zi sold commercially today are mainly seeds from qing ma zi (Abutilon theophrasti Medic). The same applies for herbs sold as dong kui zi in Taiwan (台灣市售之冬葵子藥材均為苘麻的種子). Dong kui zi (Malva crispa L. or Malva verticillata L.) and qing ma zi (Abutilon theophrasti Medic.) are two different herbs with distinct functions; they cannot be interchanged. 兩者療效不同，不可混用。
Chemical Ingredients: Seed of dong kui zi contains fat and protein.
Fresh herb contains monosaccharide 6.8-7.4%, sucrose 4.1-4.6%, maltose 4.5-4.8%, starch 1.2%.

Maladies Treated: premature ejaculation due to shenyangxu condition (Humans)
frequent urination and uncontrollable urination due to shenyangxu condition (Humans)
early morning diarrhea due to shenyangxu condition (Humans)
habitual miscarriage due to shenyangxu (kidney yang deficient) (Humans)
geriatric asthma due to shenyangxu condition (Humans)
Medical Function: Expands coronary arteries (4 times as strong as Khellin – Human/Animal research)
Light-sensitive effect
Anti-tumor effects
Estrogen-type of effect; Anti-early pregnancy
Antibiotic effect
Anti-aging
Improves white cell count; corrects low levels of adrenocortical hormone
Stops bleeding; Shortens bleeding time of menses, uterus, nose and gums
Kills parasites
Relaxes smooth muscles: uterus, bronchi
Helps to prevent rejection of skin grafts (studied in rabbits)
Anti-rheumatoid-arthritis (类风湿性关节炎)
Dosage: Daily dosage 10-20 g per day. Freeze-dried extract: 0.5-2g per day. Adjust dosage according to syndromes and body conditions.
Samples of Formulae:
Enuresis: Equal amounts bu gu zhi and yi zhi ren (60g each), stir-fry with salt, grind into powder, make 6 packets, one packet cooked in rice porridge once in morning, double dosage for adults, 6 days cycle.
Impotence, spermatorrhea, premature ejaculation due to shenyangxu: equal amount bu gu zhi, tu si zi, jin yin zi, xia long gu, bake dry in low heat, grind into powder, 10g each time, twice daily with lightly salted drinking water.
Geriatric asthma from shenyangxu: bu gu zhi 12g, dong chong xia cao 10g, decoct, take morning and evening.
Low white cell count: 500g bu gu zhi baked, powdered, mixed with 1000g honey, made pills, 10g each time, twice daily.
Flat warts (verrucae planae): external application of 20-30% alcohol extract of bu gu zhi tincture.
Contraindications: Not to be used with high heat due to yinxu condition. Antagonizes gan cao. Injection may cause shock reaction. Large dosages caused atrophy of liver and testes in mice. Large dosage in guinea pigs and rats showed teratogenic effect. Large dosages or long-term usage can be toxic to kidneys.
Research: Studies showed expanding coronary arteries (4 times stronger compared to the drug Khellin). Animal studies reported atrophy of liver and testes in mice with large dosages. Studies also indicated prevention of skin graft rejection in rabbits. Teratogenic effects observed in guinea pigs and rats at large dosages. Proven to increase white blood cell count and correct low levels of adrenocortical hormone.
References: [1] Chinese Medicine Modern Research and Clinical Application 中藥現代研究與臨床應用，學苑出版社。

現出�祛寒勿助火�的治療思想。方中藥味雖多，正韓信用兵多而不亂，主輔佐使，作用分明，相須相使，配伍巧妙；以治本為主，兼顧其標，辨病辨証， 整體治療。所以病人服藥後，不僅肢體關節腫消痛減，更重要的是全身气力增加，面色潤澤，活動能力增強，非一般祛風濕藥所可比擬。 補骨脂是傳統的補腎助陽中藥，現臨床還有不少新用途：  　　一﹐單味應用 　　（一）頸椎骨質增生：有人對經X線攝片及CT檢查診斷為頸椎骨質增生且口服﹐靜脈給藥均效差的患者，用單味補骨脂研成細末加紅糖口服，每日3次，每次10g， 服1周後頸部感覺明顯輕鬆，又服1月後諸症減輕。後經多例治療証實確有良效。 　　（二）痛經：痛經屬寒滯血凝和肝腎不足者，經前3天給予補骨脂10g研成細末加紅糖沖服，每日2次，服至經停，連服3個周期。 Maladies Treated: vaginal fungal infection (observed in human patients)
lower back pain (observed in human patients; ineffective for protruding disc and lumbar spine injury)
epilepsy (observed ineffective for frontal lobe epilepsy; not recommended for hepatorenal insufficiency; human clinical observation)
Medical Function: Rid of infection and transform phlegm; detoxification and antisepsis.

Weak alkaline, possesses weak microorganism inhibition effect similar to boric acid. Using plate method, medium containing 10% borax has inhibition effect on Escherichia coli, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Bacillus anthracis, Freund Shigella, Shigella dysentery bacillus, typhoid bacillus, paratyphoid bacillus, Proteus, Staphylococcus aureus, and Candida albicans. Using paper disc method, borax can inhibit diphtheria bacillus, the medium brucellosis, pneumococcal, meningococcal, and hemolytic streptococcus (in vitro studies).

Can be used externally to flush ulcers, abscesses and mucosal inflammations such as conjunctivitis, gastritis; due to alkaline property can clean mucosa, orally it is useful for urethral sterilization and alkalizing acidic urine (human use).
Dosage: Internal use: pill or powder form 0.5-1 qian. External use: finely ground powder for direct application or mixed for external use. Clinical dosage examples: epilepsy: sparse episodes 0.3 g each time, frequent seizures 0.5 g each time (both doses taken 3 times a day), grand mal or persistent seizures 1 g daily; vaginal infection mixture (97% borax, 3% borneol, mixed with cold cream and applied vaginally once daily); lower back pain and knee sprain small amount of calcined borax powder externally to inner canthus and yin jiao point, causing tears.
Samples of Formulae:
Clinical application:
[1] Treatment of epilepsy: Take peng sha (borax) orally. For sparse episodes use 0.3 g each time, 3 times a day. For frequent seizures use 0.5 g each time, 3 times a day. For grand mal or persistent seizures, use 1 g daily. Combine with phenytoin, vitamin D and calcium adjuvant therapy. For persistent epilepsy, beside peng sha also use 10% calcium gluconate 1 g, intravenously, twice daily until control achieved. Treatment duration: 3 months per course. From second course discontinue phenytoin, do not discontinue before starting peng sha treatment to avoid triggering seizures. If previously using other anti-epileptic drugs, alternate with peng sha then gradually phase out other drugs.
Result: 10 cases treated, significantly reduced seizure frequency; after second course, 7 cases controlled completely, 3 with minor sparse seizures. Long term usage (~1 year) reported no adverse reactions. Not effective for frontal lobe epilepsy; patients with hepatorenal insufficiency should not use.

[2] Vaginal fungal infection: Formula of 97% borax and 3% borneol; add cold cream to final concentration of 50-60%. Apply vaginally once daily, treatment course: 5 days. Result: in follow-up of 82 cases from 144 treated, cure rate was 84.1%.

[3] Lower back pain: Calcine borax till dry powder, finely grind. Apply small amount externally at inner canthus and yin jiao point, resulting in tear secretion. Patient then bends, turns waist, squats; treatment provides pain reduction after 1-3 treatments, more tears greater relief. Effective also in stiff neck, ineffective in protruding disc or lumber spine injury.

[4] Knee sprain (Peng sha san): Fine processed borax powder applied in opposite inner canthus before bedtime, 1-3 treatments effective; application causes tear secretion. [Zhejiang Journal of Traditional Chinese Medicine, 9(l): 24, 1966]
Contraindications: Use with caution internally. Prohibited orally in cases of yinxu with fire. Intended only for temporary use, not recommended for long-term treatment.
Research: Clinical studies summarized above under 'Samples of Formulae' include epilepsy treatment, vaginal fungal infections, lower back pain, and knee sprains. Contains laboratory tests for antimicrobial properties (in vitro bacterial/fungal growth inhibition observed).
Chemical Ingredients: Small amounts of lead, copper, calcium, aluminum, iron, magnesium, silicon and other impurities

For sparse episodes use 0.3 g each time, 3 times a day. For frequent seizures use 0.5 g each time, 3 times a day. For grand mal or persistent, use 1 g daily. Use peng sha in conjunction with phenytoin, vitamin D and calcium adjuvant therapy. For persistent epilepsy patients, beside using peng sha, also use 10% calcium gluconate1 g, 2 times a day intravenously. Discontinue after symptom is under control. Medication for a course is three months.  From the second course of treatment, discontinue phenytoin; Do not discontinue phenytoin before the start of the peng sha (borax) treatments. Otherwise it may frequently  lead to grand mal or persistent seizures. If other anti-epileptic drugs have been used before the application of peng sha (borax), when switching to the peng sha (borax) treatment, alternate the use of peng sha and drug. Then gradually phase out of the original drug. Otherwise, if using peng sha (borax) alone, increase the dosage of peng sha to double.Result: 10 cases, 9 cases of grand mal patients, one case was sustained attack patient. All patients were in long-term use of different epilepsy drugs and could not control their recurrence. After treatment by the method described above,  all cases were significantly effective in the first course of treatment and significantly reduced the number of attacks.  The attacks  showed only a few seconds of confusion, and  seemed to drop to petit mal condition. Some patients  showed only individual limbs or mandible movement effects without loss of consciousness. After the second course of treatment, seven cases were able to completely control the onset of symptoms. Three cases were still having sparse small seizures or localized attacks. The majority of patients were taking the treatment more than one year continuously, and there were no cases of adverse reactions or toxicity reaction.This therapy is ineffective for frontal lobe epilepsy patients. For those with hepatorenal insufficiency, it is better not to use this therapy.  Treatment of vaginal fungal infection:Composition of herb:peng sha (borax) 97%, bing pian (borneol) 3%. Mix thoroughly; then add cold cream about 50-60% of total amount end product. Use vaginal speculum to spread the vagina, and then smear the cream evenly around the wall of the vagina and vulva, once a day. Five days is a course of treatment.  Result: Treatment of 144 cases,  Follow-up of examination: 82 cases,  After a course of treatment in 59 cases, 50 cases were cured; After two courses of 17 cases, 16 cases were cured; After three courses of six cases, three cases were cured.  The total cure rate was 84.1%. Treatment of lower back pain:Place peng sha (borax) on iron pan. Heat the pan on stove till peng sha  becomes dry and powdery. Grind into very fine powder. When applying, let patient lie down supine. Pick a little calcined peng sha (borax) and apply to the two inner canthus and to the

In general after treatment, pain became reduced, The majority recovered after 1-3 treatments. It was more effective when more tears came out. Maladies Treated: Rabbit tracheitis (experimentally induced by inhalation of ammonia vapor; rabbits): treated wheezing status, relieved wheezing, reduced dry rales.
Medical Function: Arresting pain and swelling.
Expels wind, clears heat, relieves toxin.

Diuretic effect observed in mice through subcutaneous injection—large doses had opposite effect (decreased urination). Oral intake also effective, confirmed in humans as well. Efficacy diminishes if herb is stored for prolonged periods.
Treating trauma externally (topical application), possibly related to volatile oil or tannins.
Some expectorant effect due to saponins contained in herb.
Samples of Formulae: 1. Upper respiratory tract infection: yi zhi huang hua 12 g, yu xin cao 18 g, huang qi 10 g, jin yin hua 12 g, lian qiao 10 g, gan cao 6 g. Boil with water and use as tea. 2. Acute upper respiratory tract infection: yi zhi huang hua 12 g, she gan 15 g, jie geng 15 g, ma bo 10 g, jin yin hua 12 g, lian qiao 12 g, gan cao 6 g. Boil with water and use as tea.
Contraindications: Consuming by livestock can lead to paralysis, movement disorders, and other symptoms of poisoning.
Research: Antibacterial effect demonstrated in vitro against Staphylococcus aureus, Streptococcus pneumoniae, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Shigella sonnei bacilli with varying degrees of inhibition. Therapeutic effect confirmed experimentally in rabbits suffering from induced tracheitis. Diuretic properties confirmed in mice (subcutaneous injection and oral intake). Hemostatic effects in acute hemorrhagic nephritis likely linked to flavonoids, chlorogenic acid, or caffeic acid contained in herb. External treatment for trauma possibly linked to volatile oils or tannins.
